title: How to Make Checkerboard Bars

steps.headline: Place hazelnuts in the food processor; process until finally chopped, but not pasty.
Melt chocolate in a small bowl over very hot water stirring until smooth.
Combine flour, baking powder and salt in medium bowl.
Beat butter and sugar in large bowl with electric mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy.
steps.description: Beat in 1 egg and vanilla. Gradually add flour mixture; beat well.

steps.headline: Reserve 1 1/4 cups dough.
steps.description: Stir chocolate and nuts into remaining dough. Wrap both doughs in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Unwrap and roll out chocolate dough on lightly floured surface to 1/3-inch thickness with floured rolling pin.
steps.description: Cut dough into twelve 4x3/4 inch strips. Re-roll scraps as necessary, until all dough has been cut into strips. Repeat process with vanilla dough.

steps.headline: To assemble, beat remaining egg in small dish.
steps.description: Place one strip of chocolate dough on sheet of plastic wrap. Brush edge with egg. Repeat with one more chocolate strip  and one more vanilla  strip to make bottom layer. Brush top with egg.

steps.headline: Prepare second row by stacking strips on first row, alternating vanilla dough over chocolate, and chocolate dough over vanilla.
steps.description: Brush edge of each strip  and top layer with egg. Repeat the third row  to complete 1 checkerboard bar. Cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate 1 hour or until firm enough to slice.

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
steps.description: Grease cookie sheets. Cut checkerboard bar crosswise with long sharp knife into 1/4-inch slices. Place 2 inches (5.1 cm) apart on prepared cookie sheets.

steps.headline: Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until set.
steps.description: Cool cookies on cookie sheets 2 minutes. Remove cookies to wire racks; cool completely. Store tightly covered at room temperature, or freeze up to 3 months. Makes 2 dozen bars.

text: Remove the hazelnut skins.  Place hazelnuts in the food processor; process until finally chopped, but not pasty.  Melt chocolate in a small bowl over very hot water stirring until smooth.  Combine flour, baking powder and salt in medium bowl.  Beat butter and sugar in large bowl with electric mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy. Beat in 1 egg and vanilla. Gradually add flour mixture; beat well. Reserve 1 1/4 cups dough. Stir chocolate and nuts into remaining dough. Wrap both doughs in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Unwrap and roll out chocolate dough on lightly floured surface to 1/3-inch thickness with floured rolling pin. Cut dough into twelve 4x3/4 inch strips. Re-roll scraps as necessary, until all dough has been cut into strips. Repeat process with vanilla dough. To assemble, beat remaining egg in small dish. Place one strip of chocolate dough on sheet of plastic wrap. Brush edge with egg. Repeat with one more chocolate strip  and one more vanilla  strip to make bottom layer. Brush top with egg. Prepare second row by stacking strips on first row, alternating vanilla dough over chocolate, and chocolate dough over vanilla. Brush edge of each strip  and top layer with egg. Repeat the third row  to complete 1 checkerboard bar. Cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate 1 hour or until firm enough to slice. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease cookie sheets. Cut checkerboard bar crosswise with long sharp knife into 1/4-inch slices. Place 2 inches (5.1 cm) apart on prepared cookie sheets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until set. Cool cookies on cookie sheets 2 minutes. Remove cookies to wire racks; cool completely. Store tightly covered at room temperature, or freeze up to 3 months. Makes 2 dozen bars.
